feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:51PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST POSSIBLE IN VALLEY LOCATIONS THURSDAY MORNING... Clearing skies along with decreasing winds will allow temperatures to drop into the lower to mid 30s for the cold susceptible valleys across the area tonight with frost possibly developing by early Thursday morning. People with sensitive plants should take necessary precautions to protect them.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 7:59PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GLACIER DAM LAKE RELEASE ONGOING FOR SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER... The Salmon River has been rising since Sunday due to rain and snow melt, but saw a sharper rate of rise on Tuesday and Wednesday of around half a foot every 6 hours, indicating that Summit Lake was draining. The water level on the Salmon River should crest sometime Wednesday

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:18PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Through Thursday Afternoon... West winds gusting to 50 mph will continue through Thursday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:18PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 2000 Feet today through Thursday afternoon... Between 3 and 5 inches of snow is expected above 2000 feet through Thursday afternoon. This includes the Dalton Highway from Sagwon to Atigun Pass. The snow will continue tonight and Thursday before tapering off Thursday afternoon.
